Steve Irwin, "The Crocodile Hunter" from Australia Zoo has been killed.
 He was filming a documentary on the Great Barrier Reef when he was stung in the chest by a Sting Ray. Medics from Cairns were unable to save him.
 http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/asia-pacific/5311298.stm

Yeah it's too bad. He seemed like a nice enough guy.
 
 Alas a stringray, a croc chomping off his head would have been much less shocking.
That's a shame. He raised alot of awareness, and alot of money, for enviromentalism.

Alas a stringray, a croc chomping off his head would have been much less shocking.

 
 Tell me about it. I read that he died by a stingray and I was thinking all those handlings he did with crocodiles and poisoness snakes and lizards and spiders and he's taken down by a stingray?!

This morning, at 11am Australian time, things finally came unglued for the 44-year-old as he was shooting a documentary segment on stingrays. Snorkeling on Batt Reef , a stretch of the Great Barrier Reef about 15km from Port Douglas in North Queensland, Irwin happened to swim over a large ray which, startled, whipped its barbed tail upwards into his chest. He died instantly. Veteran marine wildlife documentary maker Ben Cropp, who has spent hundreds of hours filming on Batt Reef, says Irwin had come too close to a bull ray. Citing a colleague who saw footage of the attack, Cropp says Irwin had accidently boxed the animal in, causing it to attack. "It stopped and twisted and threw up its tail with the spike, and it caught him in the chest," says Cropp. "It's a defensive thing. It's like being stabbed with a dirty dagger." Says Cropp: "It's a one-in-a-million thing. I have swum with many rays, and I have only had one do that to me."

 
 :( More at Time.com....

I read that he was filming a tv show on dangerous sea creatures, and ironically the stingray was not to be included. 
 
 I liked him very much. He did marvelous things for the environment and animals, and I was quite depressed to hear about this. There aren't enough people like him in the world. :(
